availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Emmett Simms (Kentucky, Confederate soldier and politician)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, farmer, soldier, and politician. Graduate of Transylvania University law department. Admitted to the bar in 1846. Attorney in Paris, Kentucky. Married to Lucy Ann Frances Blythe Simms. Father of Lucy Blythe Simms, William E. Simms, Jr., and Edward Francis Simms. Served as a captain in the Mexican War. Elected as a member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1849 and 1851. Served the Eighth Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic Party member of the United States House of Representatives from 1859 to 1861. Colonel in the Confederate Army and as a lieutenant colonel in the Provisional Army of the Confederate States in the 1st Battalion, Kentucky Cavalry. Resigned on February 17, 1862 to serve as a Kentucky senator in the Congress of the Confederate States of America. Served in both the First and Second Confederate Congresses from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
